name: quirkily

in a way that is unusual but attractive and interesting : Even back then there was something quirkily original about her writing. The Fiat 500's quirkily stylish looks ensured that it became a huge hit across the whole of Europe.
More examplesFewer examplesThe hotel's rooms are individually and sometimes quirkily decorated.The old walled city is fabulous for exploring, not least because the streets are so quirkily narrow. The novel chronicles the romantic adventures of the quirkily named daughter of a famous artist.
